page.title: 08The quarryman's life. page 2
page.content:
{Their food Breakfast would consist of porridge,or bread and milk,or 'Brwes'. Brwes is made by pouring hot water over a slice of bread in a pudding basin adding a good lump of butter or dripping,and a sprinkling of cheese on top. To eat at the quarry they would take sandwiches of meat or cheese or homemade jam, with a slice of cake or apple tart or other fruit. When they arrived home they would eat a cooked meal of meat and potatoes and vegetables,followed by rice pudding or suet pudding according to the season.
{THE NAMES OF SLATES} They all had English names as follows, starting with the larges size Queen, princess, Duchess, Countess and Lady.
